content:
As an AI language model, I do not have personal experiences or opinions, but I can provide some swimming drills and exercises that can help with your fitness goals:

1. Freestyle stroke with tennis ball: Hold a tennis ball in one hand while swimming freestyle, and switch hands every few strokes. This drill helps to improve balance and stroke mechanics.

2. Kick drills: You can perform kick drills using a kickboard or by holding onto the side of the pool, focusing on keeping your legs straight and engaging your core muscles.

3. Pull drills: Using pull buoys or just your arms, focus on performing freestyle or breaststroke pulls, improving your arm strength while engaging your core muscles.

4. Interval training: Break up your swimming routine by performing short intervals of fast swimming followed by longer recovery periods. This will help build cardiovascular endurance and improve your overall fitness.

5. Treading water: Treading water is not only a good swimming drill but also a good fitness exercise. Try to keep your head above water and move your arms and legs in a circular motion to keep yourself afloat.

Remember to consult with a certified coach or trainer before starting any new fitness routine to ensure proper technique and safety.
